feat.name: Beyond Words (Charisma) (HB)
feat.text:
You become a master at reading body language and using that knowledge in social interactions. You gain the following benefits:
• Increase your Charisma or Wisdom score by 1, up to a maximum of 20.
• After interacting with a creature for at least 1 minute, you have advantage on all Charisma ability checks when interacting with that creature for the next 24 hours.
• After interacting with a creature for at least 1 minute, you know its Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores and what skills, if any, the creature is proficient in for those abilities.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 274 (Homebrew)

feat.name: Detective (Intelligence) (HB)
feat.text:
You notice details that few others would take into account. Your training and focus on solving crimes and mysteries have sharpened your perception and reasoning around you beyond normal limits. You gain the following benefits:
• Increase your Intelligence or Wisdom score by 1, up to a maximum of 20.
• You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception), Wisdom (Insight), and Intelligence (Investigation) checks when investigating a crime or mystery.
• When examining a crime scene with a dead body for at least 10 minutes, you can determine the cause of death and estimate how long the creature has been dead. You can also tell if the creature died in a fight and if the location where the body is found was the site of death.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 274 (Homebrew)

feat.name: Focus Inclination (HB)
feat.text:
You focus on your inclination and gain more advantages from it than other taii'makus. If you have chosen the Inclination to Philosophy, you gain the following benefits:
• While in Equilibrium, you also gain +1 bonus to your AC and to the saving throw DCs of your spells and abilities.
• You can cast spells as if you were using a spell focus, even when you are not. Your own body and mind are considered as your spell focus.
If you have chosen the Inclination to Engineering, you gain the following benefits:
• You can have up to four mechanisms linked to you instead of the three granted by the Ingenious Inventors trait.
• When making Wisdom ability checks and Wisdom saving throws, you can use your Intelligence bonus instead of your Wisdom bonus.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 274 (Homebrew)

feat.name: Improved Ancestral Kemet Magic (HB)
feat.text:
You can cast the speak with dead spell as a ritual, as your connection with your ancestors is stronger than what is normally seen in a kemet. In addition, you learn one 1st-level and one 2nd-level necromancy spell of your choice, which you can cast once each, and regain their uses after finishing a long rest. Your spellcasting ability for these spells is the same as the one chosen in Ancestral Kemet Magic.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 275 (Homebrew)

feat.name: Life Saver (HB)
feat.prerequisite: Ability to cast at least one spell that restores hit points to a creature.
feat.text:
You have trained to enhance your healing magic, making you able to react quickly when a creature would be struck down. If you know or have prepared a healing spell that has the casting time of 1 action, you can cast it as a reaction when a creature within the spell's range takes damage that would reduce their hit points to 0. This will reduce the damage that the creature would take by the amount your spell would heal it, plus your spellcasting ability modifier. Any excess reduction to the damage is lost, but it can reduce the damage to 0. If the healing spell targets multiple creatures, this benefit applies only to the attacked creature who triggered the ability. You can use this ability a number of times equal to 1 + your proficiency bonus, and you regain all uses of this ability after finishing a long rest.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 275 (Homebrew)

feat.name: Lightning Thrower (HB)
feat.text:
You become an expert in throwing weapons. When you make a ranged attack with a thrown weapon, you gain the following benefits:
• You can draw a weapon as part of the attack. If you have multiple attacks, you can draw a weapon for each attack.
• You receive a +1 bonus to your attack and damage rolls, and you can use your Dexterity modifier for attack and damage rolls even if the weapon lacks the finesse property.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 275 (Homebrew)

feat.name: Lost Magic Studies (HB)
feat.text:
A number of times equal to half your proficiency bonus (rounded up), you can apply one of the following effects to a spell you cast:
• Increase the spell save DC by 1.
• You can cast the spell as if it were one level higher than the spell slot you used, provided that the spell allows it.
You regain the use of this ability after finishing a long rest.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 275 (Homebrew)

feat.name: Master Defender (HB)
feat.text:
You mastered how to hold your ground and your shield became an extension of yourself in combat. You gain the following benefits:
• Increase your Constitution score by 1, up to a maximum of 20.
• When wielding a shield, on your turn you can choose to forgo your movement, reducing your speed to 0, and gain a +2 bonus to your AC until the start of your next turn or until you move or are moved by any means that would cause you to leave your current space.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 275 (Homebrew)

feat.name: Master of Beasts (HB)
feat.text:
You are a master in dealing with wild creatures. You gain the following benefits:
• Increase your Wisdom score by 1, up to a maximum of 20.
• You become proficient in Animal Handling and Nature, and if you already are, you double your proficiency bonus in these skills.
• When you make a Wisdom (Animal Handling) check, you can treat any roll of 9 or lower on the d20 as a 10.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 275 (Homebrew)

feat.name: Mighty Impact (HB)
feat.text:
You have trained to channel your strength to deliver devastating blows. You gain the following benefits:
• Increase your Strength score by 1, up to a maximum of 20.
• When you make a melee weapon attack with advantage and hit with both dice rolls, you can deliver a powerful blow that deals +1d4 damage of the same type caused by the weapon, and knocks the creature prone. You can only knock down a creature up to two size categories larger than you.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 275 (Homebrew)

feat.name: Mighty Marksman (HB)
feat.prerequisite: Strength 13 or higher and Dexterity 13 or higher.
feat.text:
Your physical training and strength allow you to make the most of your ranged attacks. You gain the following benefits:
• When you use a ranged weapon, its long range is doubled.
• Once per turn, you can also add your Strength modifier to the damage roll of the first ranged weapon attack that you hit on a target within the weapon's normal range.
• When you score a critical hit with a ranged weapon attack, you can roll one of the weapon's damage dice one additional time and add it to the extra damage of the critical hit.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 275 (Homebrew)

feat.name: Miraculous Brewer (Constitution) (HB)
feat.text:
You have mastered the art of brewing and gain proficiency with brewer's supplies, if you don't already have it. Additionally, you gain the following benefits:
• Increase your Constitution or Wisdom score by 1, up to a maximum of 20.
• With one hour of work during a short or long rest, you can create a number of doses of a special beer equal to twice your proficiency bonus. A creature can consume one dose of the beer as an action, granting it disadvantage on melee attacks and a bonus of 2d8 damage of the same type as its weapon until the end of its next turn. If a creature drinks more than one dose of the beer before taking a short rest, they must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC equal to 12 plus the number of doses of beer consumed. If it fails, it becomes poisoned until it finishes a short or long rest.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 276 (Homebrew)

feat.name: Potent Poison (HB)
feat.text:
You have the ability to potentiate your natural poisons, gaining the following benefits:
• Increase your Constitution score by 1, up to a maximum of 20.
• Enemies have disadvantage on saving throws against your natural gloomfolk poison, and when you hit a creature with your stinger and inject your poison, you can spend a Hit Die and add it to the damage of your stinger as poison damage. Starting at 7th level, you can use 2 Hit Dice, and starting at 14th level, you can use 3.
• You produce more poison, granting you one extra use of the poison trait before you need of a short or long rest to recover it.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 276 (Homebrew)

feat.name: Power Shot (HB)
feat.text:
You learned to turn your accuracy into deadliness. When you deal damage with a ranged weapon, once per turn, you can reroll the damage dice and choose which result to use.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 276 (Homebrew)

feat.name: Sense of Inspiration (HB)
feat.text:
You become a source of inspiration, receiving the following benefits:
• Increase your Charisma score by 1, up to a maximum of 20.
• You know how to inspire creatures through the use of words. With a bonus action, you grant a Bardic Inspiration die to a creature other than yourself, who is within 60 feet of you and can hear you. This die is always a d6, but if you are a bard, it progresses as your other Bardic Inspiration dice, but can't be used in any other way besides the one provided above. You can use this feature only once, regaining its use after a long rest. Apply all rules related to Bardic Inspiration to this die.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 276 (Homebrew)

feat.name: Sky Master (HB)
feat.text:
You become a master of the skies. You gain the following benefits:
• While flying, you have advantage on saving throws made to avoid the prone condition, or to be moved or pulled from your mount.
• You gain 2 extra Fly Points when using the aerial mounted combat rules.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 276 (Homebrew)

feat.name: Soul Connection (Strength) (HB)
feat.text:
You have a stronger connection with your other side, being able to call upon it in emergency situations. You gain the following benefits:
• Increase one ability score of your choice by 1, up to a maximum of 20.
• When you make an ability check with a skill, you can choose to use the bonus of the same skill from your other side. You can use this once, regaining its use after a short or long rest.
• When you fail a saving throw, you can attempt the same saving throw with your other side. If your other side succeeds on the saving throw, consider it a success for you as well. You can use this once, regaining its use after a short or long rest.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 276 (Homebrew)

feat.name: Soulborn Ancestrality (HB)
feat.text:
You gain characteristics from the family in which you were born, gaining the following benefits:
• If you were born human, you can increase the value of 3 abilities of your choice by 1, up to a maximum of 20.
• If you were born in a different species, you increase an ability that the species has increased by 1, up to a maximum of 20, and you acquire one of its racial traits.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 276 (Homebrew)

feat.name: Spycraft Mastery (Dexterity) (HB)
feat.text:
You are a specialist in infiltrating other kingdoms and territories and sending reports that only your allies will be able to read. You gain the following benefits:
• Increase your Dexterity, Intelligence, or Charisma score by 1, up to a maximum of 20.
• You become proficient in the Deception skill or with the disguise and forgery kits.
• You know the ways to enter nearby cities and kingdoms and can create false identities and documents to succeed. You must spend 10 days and 15 gp establishing the details of the new identity, such as documents, history, profession, affiliations, and contacts. You cannot copy the identity of someone else, but you can masterfully create a new identity that everyone will believe in until it is confronted with evidence that obviously reveals it.
• You know ways to conceal messages, whether in a cipher or encoded language, hidden in another message, or even a mixture of both methods. Only people you spend an hour teaching how to decode specific messages will know how to read them. Other people must succeed on a Wisdom (Insight) check to notice and read a message hidden within another, or on an Intelligence (Investigation) check to crack a cipher or encoded language (both checks must succeed if you used both methods in the same message). The DC is equal to 20 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 276 (Homebrew)

feat.name: Swift Polearm (HB)
feat.text:
You have learned to wield polearms with amazing speed and accuracy. When wielding a polearm weapon with the reach property, you can perform the following maneuvers a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, regaining all uses after finishing a long rest:
• When a creature you can see attacks another creature within your weapon's reach, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on that attack.
• When you hit a creature, you can deal an additional 1d6 damage of the same type as the weapon, and the creature cannot use reactions until the end of its next turn.
• When you hit a creature with a polearm weapon that has the reach property Large or smaller, you can automatically move the target to any other unoccupied space within the weapon's reach.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 277 (Homebrew)
